src.utils.parse_json module

Handle JSON Operations

class src.utils.parse_json.ParseJSONasObject(data=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class to parse list or JSON as an Object and work with as in Javascript :param data: data to work with :type data: list|dict

Example

>>> data = {"name": "John", "age": 30, "cars": [{"model": "BMW 230", "mpg": 27.5}, {"model": "Ford Edge", "mpg": 24.1}]}
Atributes:

compute_attr_value (method): compute the value of the attribute

compute_attr_value(value)[source]

Received any value that you need append to the main object, in case that the object will be an instance of a list or a dict, it send it back in a recursive way, until the function returns deepest value.

Parameters

value (any) – any data type that you have in the json

Returns

the deepest value of the object

src.utils.password module

Handle password hashing and checking based on the functionality of Flask-Bcrypt. This is a modified version of the original Flask-Bcrypt module to work without flask. For more information, see https://flask-bcrypt.readthedocs.io/

class src.utils.password.Password(rounds: Optional[int] = None, prefix: Optional[str] = None, as_long_passwords: Optional[bool] = None)[source]

Bases: object

class Password Based on flask bcrypt. Credits to Max Countryman.

Example

>>> Password(rounds=12, prefix=b"2b", as_long_passwords=True)
>>> Password().generate_password_hash("password")
>>> Password().check_password_hash("hash", "password")
_rounds

The number of rounds to use for the salt.

Type

int

_prefix

The prefix to use for the salt.

Type

str

_as_long_passwords

Whether to use long passwords.

Type

bool

check_password_hash(_hash: str, password: str) → bool[source]

Check the given hash with some string. :param hash: The hashed password. :type hash: str :param password: The password to be checked. :type password: str

Returns

True if the password is correct, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

generate_password_hash(password: str, rounds: Optional[int] = None, prefix: Optional[str] = None) → hashpw[source]

Generates a password hash using bcrypt. :param password: The password to be hashed. :type password: str :param rounds: The optional number of rounds. :type rounds: int, optional :param prefix: The algorithm version to use. :type prefix: str, optional

Returns

The hashed password.

Return type

hashpw

src.utils.pdf module

src.utils.temporary_transactions module

Handle temporary transactions create a method to generate a temporary filename

src.utils.temporary_transactions.name_it(suffix: Optional[str] = '', prefix: Optional[str] = '', extension: Optional[str] = '', path: Optional[str] = '/home/master/Documents/Cadastral/newBack/src/tmp') → str[source]

Generate a temporary filename. :param suffix: suffix that will be used at the beginning of string. Defaults to “”. :type suffix: str, optional :param prefix: preffix that will be used at the end of the string. Defaults to “”. :type prefix: str, optional :param extension: extension that will have the filename. Defaults to “”. :type extension: str, optional :param path: Location to handle file. Defaults to Paths.tmp. :type path: str, optional

Returns

a temporary filename at the path selected to work with.

Return type

str
